intro: Eriophyton marrubioides, commonly known as the Mexican mint or Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs such as parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Eriophyton marrubioides is also valued as a source of essential oils due to its strong, mint-like fragrance.
